bestBHT.bht: The parable in this teaches the impact of hearing the word of God. It speaks of a hundredfold harvest, emphasizing the abundance that can result from a receptive heart. This fruitful harvest is available to all who have ears to hear. It is in the hearts of those who truly understand and love the word that the seed can flourish, producing an abundant yield.

Marvin Vincent: A hundred - fold. Omitting the thirty and sixty of Matthew and Mark. See on Matthew 13:8.
Archibald T. Robertson: A hundredfold (εκατονπλασιονα). Luke omits the thirty and sixty of Mark 4:8; Matthew 13:8.
He cried (εφωνε). Imperfect active, and in a loud voice, the verb means.
The warning about hearing with the ears occurs also in Mark 4:9; Matthew 13:9.
John Gill: ground which both looked well, and proved well; and signifies such hearers who have good and honest hearts, made so by the Spirit of God; who receive the word in the love of it, have a spiritual understanding, and real experience of it
a hundred grains for one that was sown...the word of God is more fruitful in some of those gracious hearers than in others
he that hath ears to hear, let him hear

bhtAttempts.bht: The parable in Luke 8:8 teaches a profound truth about the impact of hearing the word of God. The imagery of a hundredfold harvest emphasizes the abundant fruit that can be produced when the word is received with a receptive heart. This harvest is not limited to a select few but is available to all who have ears to hear. It is in the hearts of those who truly love and understand the word that the seed can take root and flourish, resulting in a bountiful yield.

The parable in this passage illustrates the impact of hearing the word of God. It speaks of a harvest that yields a hundredfold, emphasizing the abundance that can result from a receptive heart. This fruitful harvest is not limited and is available to all those who have ears to hear. It is in the hearts of those who truly understand and love the word that the seed can take root and flourish, producing an abundant yield.

The parable in this verse teaches the impact of hearing the word of God. It speaks of a hundredfold harvest, emphasizing the abundance that can result from a receptive heart. This fruitful harvest is available to all who have ears to hear. It is in the hearts of those who truly understand and love the word that the seed can flourish, producing an abundant yield.

The parable in this teaches the impact of hearing the word of God. It speaks of a hundredfold harvest, emphasizing the abundance that can result from a receptive heart. This fruitful harvest is available to all who have ears to hear. It is in the hearts of those who truly understand and love the word that the seed can flourish, producing an abundant yield.

The parable in this verse highlights the immense impact of truly hearing the word of God. It speaks of a hundredfold harvest, emphasizing the abundance that can result from a receptive heart. This fruitful harvest, available to all with attentive ears, is possible in the hearts of those who genuinely grasp and love the word. By allowing the seed of the message to take root and flourish, a bountiful yield is produced.
